= Introduction =
Based on a [http://ayozone.org/2009/01/08/install-gnome-globalmenu-07-series/ guide by Ayoli]


1. Get the required packages to build vala and gnome-globalmenu :

{{{
sudo apt-get install build-essential flex bison gnome-common libglib2.0-dev gtk-doc-tools autoconf2.13 automake1.9 libgtk2.0-dev libdbus-glib-1-dev libwnck-dev libpanel-applet2-dev libgnome-menu-dev
}}}

2. Get, compile and install vala 0.5.3 :

Get Vala

{{{
cd ~/
wget -c http://download.gnome.org/sources/vala/0.5/vala-0.5.3.tar.bz2
tar xjvf vala-0.5.3.tar.bz2
cd vala-0.5.3/
}}}

Make sure that no older version of vala is installed 

{{{
sudo make uninstall
sudo apt-get remove vala
}}}

Configure and Compile Vala

{{{
./configure
make
sudo make install
sudo ldconfig
}}}

3. Grab the latest revision of GlobalMenu, compile and install it :

Download GlobalMenu

{{{
cd ~/
svn checkout http://gnome2-globalmenu.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ gnome-globalmenu-0.7
cd gnome-globalmenu-0.7
}}}

Configure and Compile GlobalMenu

{{{
./autogen.sh
./configure --prefix=/usr
make
sudo make install
}}}

4. If you had globalmenu before and have this line in your ~/.gnomerc or ~/.profile : remove it

export GTK_MODULES=globalmenu-gnome

5. Add the GlobalMenu to your panel and enable it

    * Right click on an empty part of your panel
    * choose “Add to panel” from the popup menu
    * Scroll down until you see “Global Menu Panel Applet”
    * Select it and click “add” (or drag and drop it on the panel) 
    * Globalmenu can now be enabled via the preferences dialog of the applet. 
    * Right Click on the applet
    * Choose preferences
    * Check the first option : “Enable Global Menu For GTK Applications”.


And voilà ! :)
